session.name: Contributed Orals: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques

paper.main_class: MC3: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques
paper.publishable: No, Editor Status Code is not Publishable, Final QA Not Publishable
paper.title: SRF Gun with Warm Photocathode
paper.abstract: The 113 MHz superconducting gun is used an electron source for the coherent electron cooling experiment. The unique feature of the gun is that a photocathode is held at room temperature. It allowed to preserve the quantum efficiency of Cs2KSb cathode which is adversely affected by cryogenic temperatures. Relatively low frequency permitted fully realize the accelerating field gradient what in in turn helps to achieve 10 nC charge and 0.3 microns normalized emittance. We present the achieved performance an operational experience as well.
paper.agency: Work supported by Brookhaven Science Associates, LLC under Contract No. DE-AC02-98CH10886 with the U.S. Department of Energy.

paper.main_class: MC3: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques
paper.title: Negative Muonium Ion Production With a C12A7 Electride Film
paper.abstract: Negative muonium ion production is one of methods to cool muons. Since its discovery in 1987 by interactions of muons with a metal foil, it has been discussed that the production efficiency would be improved using a low-work function material. C12A7 (12CaO・7AlO3) was a well-known insulator as a constituent of alumina cement, but was recently confirmed to exhibit electric conductivity by electron doping. The C12A7 electride has lower work function (2.9 eV) and it was reported that nearly the same negative current signal as that with a bi-alkali material coated metal were observed in H- formation. In this poster, the negative muonium production measurement with a Al foil and C12A7 electride film will be presented.
paper.agency: This work was supported by OSPS KAKENHI Grant Numbers JP15H03666, JP 16H03987, JP18H03707.

abstract_log.comments: 1. Keeping the unity: e.g. "low-work function" used in the Abstract while "low work function" used elsewhere. 2. Section Introduction, Lines 3-4: use "a sensitive test" or "sensitive tests". 3. The end of Section Introduction: "summarizes" to "summarize". 4. Section Setup, Paragraph 5: remove the full stop in front of "CAEN V1720". 5. Section Result, Paragraph 1: "positron events has" to "positron events have". 6. Section Result, Paragraph 1: "In conclusions" to "In conclusion" if only one conclusion to be made here. 7. Section Result, Paragraph 4: "fr" to "for".
abstract_log.editor_notes: Measurements of the Mu− intensity with different targets (Al, SUS and C12A7 electride) are reported. Obtained results are useful for understanding the process of the Mu− production. The paper is generally well written. A few corrections are suggested by the referee.

abstract_log.comments:
Dear author,
Please resubmit your paper with no postal codes in the author list, no links in the text, no red text, Fig. 3 cited in the text, table captions in initial caps (each major word capitalized) and without a period at the end. Also refs. to journal articles and proceedings should include the paper title, and references to JACoW papers should include the titles and either paper number or doi (see JACoW template). You might try our new reference tool, which will provide this information for you very quickly: https://ref.ipac19.org/. Thank you!

abstract_log.editor_notes: In PDF, tweaked references, one figure caption, and moved one fig. on p. 2 to fit within the margins.

abstract_log.comments: Dear Masashi, The pdf of your talk is suitable for publication will be included in the proceedings as submitted. Kind Regards, jan.chrin@psi.ch

paper.main_class: MC3: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques
paper.title: The Design Optimization of the Dielectric Assist Accelerating Structure for Better Heat and Gas Transfer
paper.abstract: The dielectric-assist accelerating (DAA) structure is a dielectric-inserted normal-conducting cavity, which provides high Q value at room temperature. This accelerating structure is composed of dielectric disks and a dielectric cylindrical layer inserted in a copper cavity. For the realistic operation, the removal of heat from the dielectric cells and the vacuum evacuation of gas inside the cylindrical layers have not considered yet. In order to solve the problems, we propose the optimized design of the DAA structure, where the extended part of the dielectric disk is embedded in the copper cavity and the choke structure is applied. We show the result of the electromagnetic-field simulation of the extended DAA structure and the thermal simulation to clarify the relation between a duty factor and maximum temperature of the dielectric cells.

abstract_log.comments: ・page 1, right, line 9, need space. "...extended disk. A solution..." ・page 2, left, line 1, need space. "...during the welding changes the..." ・page 2, left, line 15 from bottom, "...In an appendix of this paper,..." there is no appendix in this paper. ・page 3, left, line 4 it is not clear what "the gapped DAA structure" means. Please make it clear the motivation of Type-1g and relation between other types.
